The Buddha spoke this.
And this is how it should be recited:
“Having directly known the whole world,
the Tathāgata sees the whole world as it really is.
He is detached from the whole world,
he is not attached to anything in the world.
He is the hero who has overcome everything,
he is the one who has freed himself from all bonds.
He has attained the supreme peace,
Nibbāna, which is free from all fear.
He is the Buddha who has destroyed the corruptions,
he is free from suffering, his doubts are cut off.
He has reached the end of all action,
he is liberated through the destruction of attachment.
He is the Blessed One, the Buddha,

analyzed: esa sīhaḥ anuttaraḥ  sa devakassa lokassa
translated: he is the unsurpassed lion,🔽he has set rolling the wheel of Brahmā
in the world with its gods.
Thus gods and men
who have gone for refuge to the Buddha,
having come together, pay homage to him,
the great one who is free from passion.
He is the tamed one, best of those who tame,
the peaceful one, the sage who is peaceful,🔽the liberated one, the foremost of those who liberate,
the one who has crossed over, the best of those who lead across.
Thus they pay homage to him,
the great one who is free from passion;
in the world with its gods
there is no one who is his equal.”

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
